body_html: in the second case, b is the result of 1 / x, and the derivative wrt x is -1 / x^2, which does not require b in the formula. In this case, if you make c = ((-a).exp()+1); b = 1 / c and then do an in-place operation on c, the backward will complain the same.
body_text: in the second case, b is the result of 1 / x, and the derivative wrt x is -1 / x^2, which does not require b in the formula. In this case, if you make c = ((-a).exp()+1); b = 1 / c and then do an in-place operation on c, the backward will complain the same.
body: in the second case, b is the result of `1 / x`, and the derivative wrt `x` is `-1 / x^2`, which does not require `b` in the formula. In this case, if you make `c = ((-a).exp()+1); b = 1 / c` and then do an in-place operation on `c`, the backward will complain the same.
